questions.question: Which AWS architecture provides high availability with minimal operational overhead?
options: Multi-AZ behind an Application Load Balancer
questions.explanation: Multi-AZ with an ALB provides high availability within a region while keeping operational complexity low.

questions.question: You need active-passive failover across Regions with the lowest steady-state cost. What should you choose?
options: Global Accelerator with two active endpoints
Route 53 failover records pointing to a warm standby stack
Active-active stacks behind an anycast IP
questions.explanation: Route 53 failover with a warm standby minimizes cost while enabling health-based DNS failover to a passive Region.

questions.question: A production Aurora MySQL cluster must survive AZ failure with zero data loss. What is the simplest setup?
options: Aurora cluster spanning at least 2 AZs with reader endpoints
Aurora Global Database with secondary Region
questions.explanation: Aurora automatically replicates 6 copies across 3 AZs; a multi-AZ cluster with readers handles AZ failure without data loss.
